post.title: Headless Adaptive Form : Getting Started
post.content:
Before setting up the dev environment, please download the binaries and install them as mentioned in the Pre-requisites section and then proceed ahead

# Pre-requisites

For this lab, you will require knowledge to build application using react and the following software to set up a development environment.

1. [Java 11](https://www.oracle.com/in/java/technologies/javase/jdk11-archive-downloads.html). Once installed ensure the `java` command works on the command line and `JAVA_HOME` environment variable is set in your system.
2. [Maven 3.5.X or later](https://maven.apache.org/download.cgi). [Installation Instructions](https://maven.apache.org/install.html)
3. [Node v16.X.X](https://nodejs.org/en/)
4. IDE - We will be using Visual Studio Code. If you are using [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/download), download the [Adaptive Form Builder Extension](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/docs/experience-manager-headless-adaptive-forms/assets/adaptive-form-builder-0.11.0.vsix?lang=en) as well. To install the extension follow the steps as per the [official Microsoft documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/extension-marketplace#_install-from-a-vsix)
5. [AEM Cloud SDK AEM SDK v2022.7.8005.20220711T194049Z-220600](https://experience.adobe.com/#/downloads/content/software-distribution/en/aemcloud.html?package=/content/software-distribution/en/details.html/content/dam/aemcloud/public/aem-sdk-2022.7.8005.20220711T194049Z-220600.zip)
6. [AEM Forms add-on v2022.07.06.02-220600](https://experience.adobe.com/#/downloads/content/software-distribution/en/aemcloud.html?package=/content/software-distribution/en/details.html/content/dam/aemcloud/public/aem-forms-addon-2022.07.06.02-220600.zip)

To download the supported version of Adobe Experience Manager as a Cloud Service SDK and AEM Forms add-on, Your Adobe Organization must be provisioned for AEM as a Cloud Service to download the AEM as a Cloud Service SDK

Before moving ahead ensure `java`, `mvn`, `node`, `npm` are configured in your path and are working on the command line.
